column2: 一开始我没有听到任何关于[adventurous_spirit.GetTitledFirstName]的消息，我以为[adventurous_spirit.GetHerHis]归途不过是被推迟了。令人遗憾地，如今我正式从[the_protector_general.GetTitledName]那里得到了[adventurous_spirit.GetHerHis]死讯。
§Y派遣一名医生§!
你已经向中国派出一名医生了，你不能再派遣了。
道观
在前往中华帝国的旅途中

[From.Offmap.Ruler.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetTitle]的[From.GetTitle]向[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]的[Root.GetTitle]寄了封信。\n\n你辜负了[From.Offmap.Ruler.GetLongChineseEmperorName]的天恩。我们知道[FromFrom.GetChineseCharacterRole] [FromFrom.GetTitledName]的死是由你一手造成。不要以为[From.Offmap.Ruler.GetTitle]会轻饶此事。
你将随机逮捕目标的一名§Y近亲§!。
未被领主要求和平
不可使用§Y角色设计器§!
角色设计器开启，成就不可用。
§Y要求§!:
§Y这是一个旧存档，加载它或会导致各种问题§!
外部因素使这个贸易路线的贸易价值增加$VALUE|+0%$.
你不能同其他玩家使用同一角色
向§Y[Root.Offmap.Ruler.GetMediumChineseEmperorName]§!表现你的忠诚。
以§R50%收入§!、§R30%部队数额§!以及§R[GetChineseOffmapTributaryPrestigeCost]§!为代价，获得§G每月2点天恩§!以及§G在被攻击时可征召中国军团§!的能力。\n这些效果持续到§Y该朝代对中国统治的终结§!，或者通过（战争、决议）§Y得到独立§!后取消。\n
你皈依了东方宗教，但是没有印度罗阇或玉龙DLC，因此你不能再继续游戏了。\n
§R你不能以这个宗教进行游戏，否则会导致游戏结束！§!\n

没有§Y残废§!或§Y年老体衰§!\n

how old age often makes one wish for times long gone
how regressive it can feel to discuss politics with the older generation
the various things we get up to, as members of [This.Society.GetName]
our mutual fascination for battle and strategy
the thrill of hunting, and the outdoors life
the undeniable excitement and joy one gets from pursuing one's true passions, in this earthly life
the intrigues at court, and an enticing rumor about a certain foreign diplomat
everything that supposedly, and actually, can happen during an extravagant feast
the value of kinship, and the importance of family
ways to interpret a holy text, and the comforting aspects of faith
human curiosity, and the sometimes debated concept of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]
the sometimes thankless effort of trying to do right by your administration, as well as your people
the intricacies of a well functioning administration, and the skill of delegating
the finer points of [Root.Culture.GetName] culture and etiquette
the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith, and our favorite hymns
the landscape of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], and particularly around [Root.Capital.GetName]
the beauty of old things, and the many trinkets we keep in our treasuries
